overview.intro: My research focuses on the intersection of multiple disciplines, including manufacturing science, fluid mechanics, and the collaborative use of computational and experimental methods. I am focusing on three key areas:

pillars.title: Material Behavior
pillars.description: Investigating the mechanical behavior of materials under various manufacturing processes to understand their properties better.

pillars.title: Advanced Modeling
pillars.description: Applying the theory of continua, data-driven modeling, and experimental mechanics through innovative testing and constitutive models.

pillars.title: Manufacturing Integration
pillars.description: Exploring the integration of additive manufacturing in fluid mechanics to revolutionize fluid systems and address fundamental challenges.

coreAreas.title: Viscoelastic Modeling
coreAreas.description: Developing thermodynamic models and frameworks to capture nonlinear viscoelastic behavior in complex materials, particularly asphaltic materials and polymeric solutions. I create computational modules that solve viscoelastic constitutive equations and study phenomena like Rayleigh–Bénard convection in non-Newtonian fluid systems.

coreAreas.title: Additive Manufacturing
coreAreas.description: Expertise in Fused Filament Fabrication (FFF/3D printing) and Friction Stir Additive Manufacturing (FSAM). My work focuses on process optimization, support structure design, and characterization of mechanical properties in additively manufactured polymeric and metallic materials.

coreAreas.title: Fracture Mechanics
coreAreas.description: Analysis of fracture toughness in thermoplastics produced through FFF processes. I investigate stress concentrations in porous materials and work on understanding failure mechanisms in additively manufactured components.

ongoing.title: Optimizing Support Structures in Metal 3D Printing
ongoing.description: Serving as a CO-PI on a funded project aimed at removing or weakening supports for metal additive manufacturing parts. The project develops protocols to introduce weak inclusions within supports to reduce material's shear strength while maintaining support functionality by varying local porosity during printing.
highlights: Reduces reliance on skilled labor for post-processing
Improves automation potential of metal 3D printing

ongoing.title: Fatigue Analysis of Polymers
ongoing.description: Addressing challenges posed by fatigue in polymers subjected to repeated mechanical and thermal load cycles. While extensive research exists on fatigue in metals, understanding these mechanisms in polymers remains understudied, hindering material selection for achieving desired load support and longevity.
highlights: Establishes framework for resilient polymer designs
Focuses on medical devices and aerospace applications
Bridges knowledge gap in polymer fatigue behavior

ongoing.title: Support Structure Characterization
ongoing.description: Research into understanding and characterizing support structures in powder bed fusion to improve part quality and reduce material waste. This work complements optimization efforts in metal additive manufacturing.

ongoing.title: Energetic Materials Certification
ongoing.description: Development of experiment-driven certification methods for energetic materials manufactured using powder material extrusion techniques. This research addresses critical needs in advancing additive manufacturing capabilities for specialized materials.
highlights: Enables new applications in energetic systems

longterm.title: Smart Manufacturing of 3D Printed Polymers
longterm.subtitle: Linking Process Parameters to Residual Stress Through Thermodynamic Modeling
longterm.description: While additive manufacturing empowers creation of complex 3D objects with design freedom, accurately predicting final assembly strength remains challenging due to material anisotropy. This research aims to bridge the gap by analyzing how printing parameters influence residual stress and its long-term impact on part behavior.
approach: Leverage thermodynamic framework to model anisotropic viscoelastic response
Develop experimental protocols using X-ray diffraction (XRD) for internal stress analysis
Incorporate in-situ, non-destructive process monitoring via thermal imaging
Enable real-time feedback for adaptive control

longterm.title: Fatigue Behavior and Life Cycle Assessment of Metal AM Parts
longterm.subtitle: A Multiscale Perspective
longterm.description: Metal additive manufacturing can produce complex components once unattainable through conventional methods. Understanding material response under cyclic loading requires multiscale analysis encompassing crack initiation, propagation, and final fracture stages.
approach: Analyze effects of process parameters across multiple scales
Investigate pores and surrounding material behavior
Develop strategies for mitigating damage at each stage

longterm.title: Instability-Driven Mixing of Viscoelastic Fluids
longterm.subtitle: In Complex Domains
longterm.description: This research focuses on the intricate flow behavior of viscoelastic fluids in complex structures. Unlike Newtonian fluids, these materials exhibit unique elastic instabilities even at low flow rates, posing challenges for mixing applications.
approach: Develop computational models for viscoelastic fluid flow through complex geometries
Study elastic turbulence onset and control mechanisms
Leverage static mixers for efficiency and compactness
Conduct rigorous experimental validation (3-5 year focus)
longterm.applications: Pharmaceuticals, food processing, chemical, manufacturing industries

secondary.title: Green Production & Sustainable Manufacturing
secondary.description: Investigating combining recycled and virgin polymers in additive manufacturing to promote sustainable production and minimize environmental impact while optimizing resource use.

secondary.title: Mathematical Drug Delivery Modeling
secondary.description: Applying mathematical and computational techniques to simulate interactions between Newtonian fluids (pharmaceutical drugs) and non-Newtonian fluids (blood), including diffusion effects and instabilities.
